items.text: Buddy statements from fellow service members

conditions.name: Lumbar Degenerative Disc Disease
conditions.evidence: Service treatment records show multiple sick call visits for lower back pain starting 2008. MRI dated 03/2022 confirms L4-L5 and L5-S1 disc herniation with nerve impingement. Physical therapy records from 2019-2023. Buddy statement from SSG Williams confirming injury during deployment. Current treatment includes pain management and steroid injections every 3 months.
conditions.inServiceProof: LOD determination dated 06/15/2009 for back injury during convoy operations in Iraq. STRs show 14 documented visits for back pain 2008-2012. Profile limiting lifting to 25lbs issued 2010.
conditions.notes: Strong claim - direct service connection with clear documentation. Consider secondary claims for radiculopathy.

conditions.name: PTSD with Major Depressive Disorder
conditions.evidence: Combat deployment to Iraq 2008-2009, Afghanistan 2011. Witnessed IED attacks and lost 3 squad members. VA mental health records show ongoing treatment since 2013. Currently prescribed Sertraline 100mg and Prazosin for nightmares. Attends weekly group therapy. GAF score of 45 documented in 2023 evaluation.
conditions.inServiceProof: Combat Action Badge awarded. After Action Reports document traumatic events. VA Form 21-0781 completed with stressor verification. Service records confirm deployment dates and unit assignment.
conditions.notes: Verified combat stressors. Strong occupational and social impairment documented. Sleep disturbance, hypervigilance, and avoidance behaviors well-documented.

conditions.name: Bilateral Tinnitus
conditions.evidence: Constant ringing in both ears since 2009. MOS was 11B Infantry - extensive weapons exposure without adequate hearing protection. Audiogram shows high-frequency hearing loss consistent with noise exposure. Buddy statement from platoon member confirming weapons training and combat noise exposure.
conditions.inServiceProof: MOS 11B confirmed on DD-214. Weapons qualification records. Deployment to combat zone with documented firefights.
conditions.notes: Presumptive for combat veterans. Maximum rating for tinnitus is 10%.

conditions.name: Left Knee Patellofemoral Syndrome
conditions.evidence: Chronic left knee pain and instability. X-rays show early arthritis and cartilage wear. Physical therapy records from 2020-2023. Uses knee brace for prolonged standing/walking. Range of motion limited to 90 degrees flexion.
conditions.inServiceProof: STRs document knee injury during airborne operations 2010. Profile issued for running. Multiple sick call visits for knee pain during service.
conditions.notes: Document limitation of flexion and instability separately for potential separate ratings.

conditions.name: Obstructive Sleep Apnea
conditions.evidence: Diagnosed via sleep study 2021 - AHI of 22 events/hour. Prescribed CPAP machine, uses nightly. Weight gain and fatigue documented. Spouse statement regarding loud snoring and breathing interruptions observed since 2012.
conditions.inServiceProof: Buddy statements noting snoring during deployment. Weight records show gain during service. Seeking nexus letter to connect to service or secondary to PTSD medications.
conditions.notes: Consider secondary connection to PTSD (weight gain from medications) or direct connection based on in-service symptoms.

conditions.name: Right Shoulder Rotator Cuff Tear
conditions.evidence: MRI confirms partial thickness tear of supraspinatus tendon. Limited range of motion - cannot raise arm above shoulder level. Compensating causes neck and upper back pain. Cortisone injections provide temporary relief.
conditions.inServiceProof: Injury documented during combatives training 2011. Physical therapy referral in service. Continued complaints at separation physical.
conditions.notes: Document painful motion and functional loss. Consider secondary claim for cervical strain.

medicalEntries.treatment: Continued pain management, steroid injection scheduled
medicalEntries.dutyImpact: Unable to lift over 10lbs, limited standing/walking
medicalEntries.notes: Patient reports pain level 6/10. Radiating to left leg. Dr. Sarah Chen, Pain Management at VA Medical Center.

medicalEntries.dutyImpact: Occupational impairment - difficulty with crowds, hypervigilance
medicalEntries.notes: Nightmares 4-5x per week. Increased Prazosin to 3mg. Discussed avoidance behaviors. Dr. Michael Roberts, Psychiatry.
Third injection this year. Moderate relief expected 2-3 weeks. Dr. James Wilson, Interventional Pain.
CPAP compliance at 78%. Adjusted pressure settings. Weight stable. Dr. Lisa Park, Sleep Medicine.

medicalEntries.treatment: Physical therapy referral, knee brace issued
medicalEntries.dutyImpact: Cannot run or climb stairs without pain
medicalEntries.notes: ROM 0-90 degrees. Crepitus present. X-ray shows joint space narrowing. Dr. Robert Kim, Orthopedics.

medicalEntries.dutyImpact: Unable to work for 2 days following episode
medicalEntries.followUp: Follow up with psychiatry within 1 week
medicalEntries.notes: Triggered by fireworks. Hyperventilation, tachycardia. Stabilized and released from VA Medical Center ER.

medicalEntries.dutyImpact: Cannot lift arm above shoulder level
medicalEntries.followUp: Discuss surgery if no improvement in 3 months
medicalEntries.notes: Cannot lift arm above shoulder. Surgery discussed as option if no improvement. Dr. Robert Kim, Orthopedics.

medicalEntries.diagnosis: Bilateral sensorineural hearing loss with tinnitus
medicalEntries.dutyImpact: Difficulty hearing in meetings, phone conversations
medicalEntries.notes: High frequency loss 4000-8000Hz bilateral. Constant tinnitus reported. Dr. Amanda Foster, Audiology.

medicalEntries.issue: Lower back injury - convoy IED blast
medicalEntries.treatment: Bed rest, muscle relaxants, profile issued
medicalEntries.dutyImpact: Non-deployable for 30 days, no lifting over 10lbs
medicalEntries.notes: LOD initiated. Vehicle struck by IED. Thrown against interior. Medevac to CSH. Combat Medic / FOB Warrior, Iraq.
Reports nightmares, difficulty sleeping. Witnessed multiple casualties. Follow-up recommended. CPT Williams, Combat Stress, Camp Liberty, Iraq.
